message.content:
cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.NE, cs.CV. 

This paper proposes a new metric for evaluating machine translation using deep learning and natural language inferencing. The paper focuses on the semantic similarity between candidate and reference translations, which falls under the category of natural language processing (NLP). Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CL (Computation and Language). Additionally, the paper uses BERT's pre-trained implementation of transformer networks, which falls under the category of artificial intelligence (AI), making cs.AI another likely sub-category. The paper also uses deep learning for determining semantic similarity, which falls under the category of machine learning (ML), making cs.LG (Learning) another possible sub-category. The paper also applies its evaluation metric on image captioning, which falls under the category of computer vision (CV), making cs.CV another possible sub-category. Finally, the paper uses deep learning for natural language inferencing, which falls under the category of neural networks (NE), making cs.NE another possible sub-category.
